001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003/**
004 * Logs events.
005 */
006public interface LogEventLogger {
007
008        /*
009         * TODO rename this to LogEventSink to avoid confusion with slf4j loggers.
010         */
011
012        /**
013         * Logs events usually without filtering. <strong> There is no guarantee this call
014         * will check if the event should be filtered (threshold is too low) and in general
015         * does not on purpose! </strong>
016         * @param event event.
017         */
018        public void log(LogEvent event);
019
020        // /**
021        // * Logs events usually without filtering. Just like {@link #log(LogEvent)}
022        // * but the consumer will be called when this sink is done with the event.
023        // * This is for asynchronous loggers but calling this method does not guarantee
024        // * non-blocking. The default implementation assume synchronous behavior
025        // * of {@link #log(LogEvent)}.
026        // * @param event event.
027        // * @param onComplete
028        // */
029        // default void log(LogEvent event, Consumer<? super LogEvent> onComplete) {
030        // log(event);
031        // onComplete.accept(event);
032        // }
033
034}
